Context:
The program offers a Gemmology course with the following required courses in Semester 1: JEWL 1005 (Gemmology 1), JEWL 1072 (Science for Gemmology), JEWL 1047 (Jewellery as an Industry*), COMM 2000 (Communicating Across Contexts). In Semester 2: JEWL 1079 (Gemmology 2), JEWL 1008 (Diamond Grading), JEWL 1006 (Jewellery Appraisal), and JEWL 1083 (History of Jewellery and Gemstones). Students need a personal laptop or desktop computer and reliable internet access. Career opportunities include employment in the retail trade, repair, wholesale, jewellery manufacturing, mining, appraisal, and auction houses. Graduates can transfer credits towards further study to attain a degree in Jewellery and Gemmology.

Required instruments for gemmology practice include microscopes, spectroscopes, refractometers, and polariscopes. Visual acuity and accurate color rendition are essential traits for success in gemmology. Refractive Index liquid (RI liquid), containing diiodomethane, is used in gemmology lab work. Pregnant women or those with certain medical conditions or sensitivity to RI liquid should consult their physicians before attending the program due to potential exposure to the chemical.

*Note: Jewellery as an Industry course is common with other GBC programs.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Gemmology Program F105 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The graduate of this program can identify a large number of gemstones and gem materials, use and maintain gemmological instruments and testing equipment, grade gemstones based on their physical and chemical characteristics, grade diamonds based on cut, clarity, color, and carat weight, apply jewellery appraisal skills, contextualize jewellery historically and stylistically, and conduct ethical business practices.

Tuition fees for the first two semesters of the program starting in Fall 2022 are $4,916 for domestic students and $18,644 for international students. Tuition fees do not include books and additional supplies. Financial assistance is available for eligible applicants through OSAP. Applicants need an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent, including grade 12 English (C or U), and basic computer literacy in Word and Excel. Mature students may take the Admissions Assessment for English or upgrade their English credits.

Program information is subject to change without notice. Students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Gemmology Program F105 | George Brown College2023.txt

2. Country-specific admission requirements for international students can be found on the International Admissions page.
3. Visual acuity and accurate colour rendition are essential traits for success in gemmology.
4. Use of good laboratory practices is recommended when handling refractive index liquid, which contains diiodomethane. Special precautions may be necessary for those who are pregnant, have certain medical conditions, or have sensitivity to or allergies to this chemical.
5. Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges, while international students should use the George Brown College Online Application System.
6. The School of Fashion and Jewellery can be contacted at 416-415-5000 ext. 4840 or via email at fashionandjewellery@georgebrown.ca.
7. The Casa Loma Campus is located at 160 Kendal Ave., Toronto, Ontario, Canada. On-campus information sessions are available.
8. International recruitment representatives can be contacted by booking a virtual meeting or submitting an inquiry on the International Contact Us page.
